text: X, The Life and Times of Malcolm X is an opera with music by Anthony Davis and libretto by Thulani Davis based on the life of the civil rights leader Malcolm X. ==Performance history== The opera premiered in a full production at the American Music Theater Festival in Philadelphia, PA on October 9, 1985 and was subsequently revised and expanded for a production at the New York City Opera on September 28, 1986. The latter was listed as the world premiere in accordance with an agreement made between then-NYCO artistic director Beverly Sills, and AMTF directors Eric Salzman and Marjorie Samoff.Henahan, Donal "Anthony Davis's 'X, The Life and Times of Malcolm X'", New York Times, September 29, 1986Rockwell, John "Opera: 'X,' A Pre-Debut" New York Times, October 11, 1985G. Schirmer, Anthony Davis: X, The Life and Times of Malcolm X The Oakland Opera Theater performed the work in June 2006.Kosman, Joshua, "Scrappy Oakland theater triumphantly revives gripping Malcolm X opera", San Francisco Chronicle, June 6, 2006 New York City Opera presented an abridged concert version on May 12, 2010 at the Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture. ==Roles== *Malcolm (baritone) *Elijah/Street (high tenor) *Louise/Betty (soprano) *Ella (mezzo-soprano) *Reginald (bass-baritone) *Young Malcolm Little (boy soprano) ==Recordings== Gramavision: Orchestra of St. Lukes, William Henry Curry, conductor (1992) ==References== Category:1986 operas Category:Cultural depictions of Malcolm X Category:English-language operas Category:Opera world premieres at New York City Opera Category:Operas Category:Operas about politicians Category:Operas by Anthony Davis Category:Operas set in the 20th century Category:Operas set in the United States Category:Political operas
